data.title: Quaint Establisment
data.text: Great spot to stop in for a bite to eat and people watch.  try the Mac & Cheese or a burger both are great.

data.title: A trendy spot with seriously good food!
data.text: We went here on a recent trip to Redlands for lunch on Halloween, and were so glad we stopped in. Firstly, the interior is lovely - it had a really lovely atmosphere. Our server was great - a friendly and smiley blonde girl who was really welcoming and helpful. I ordered a cocktail that wasn't on the menu and they were really obliging. She recommended the daily burger special, and it was absolutely incredible!! The food prices are really really competitive, which for such a trendy type of bar was refreshing. I definitely recommend this place!

data.title: Try the Poutine!
data.text: Ok, I got this dish by accident but absolutely loved it.  The drinks are great too!  Great place for happy hour!

data.title: Great Food and Drinks
data.text: The food and Whisky selection at The State are both awesome. The Portabello fries are absolutely addictive!! Great steaks,hand-made burgers and fresh buns and specialty dishes. The portions are a little small, and finding parking is a nightmare, but it's a definite must-try.

data.title: Overrated
data.text:
Since this restaurant opened, I wanted to go here.  Well, my husband and I finally went with a few friends for my birthday.  It was just a Tuesday evening. We had to wait- no problem since there are some good beer selections at the bar.  Problem- AWFUL service at the bar!!!  I felt like walking out. We were ignored for 10 minutes.  The bartender finally got an order for my husband and I but ignored our friends.  They need better organization/ hospitality or more help.  Other problem- poor hostess skills.  We saw a table that could have fit our party but it sat there for 10 minutes empty.  She then said that we could sit there but said no when she realized that she wrote our party number down wrong.  So then, we had to wait another five minutes for another table to be cleared even though that other table could have fit our party of 5.  So disappointing until we got our table.  :(  

Once we sat down, the service was good.  Food was good too.  It was difficult to read the menu in the dark.  They put a vertical line after each menu option so I though that macaroni and cheese was $19 instead of $9.  

Would I go back?  Probably not!

data.title: Excellent, food fast and friendly service
data.text: Excellent, food fast and friendly service, I had the Bourbon Burger it was delicious, the fries were home made real french fries not the frozen type like other restaurants in the area, we also tried the Poutine it was amazing, the cocktails were great all made with fresh squeezed juices, we'll definatly be coming back soon.

data.title: Air Conditioned and Rustic
data.text:
The State is your typical hometown pub that caters mostly to locals but warmly welcomes out of towners. Very friendly staff.  The inside is very rustic with the feel of old San Francisco. Drinks are solid but the food appears to be average at best.  I had the local burger and onion rings. Servings huge but flavor nothing special.
Location is downtown surrounded by many small shops.  Parking is unmetered but get there early.  All spots fill up around 9:30 a.m. The State is located in the busy downtown area.  Great for shopping before stopping in for a cool one.  I do recommend it.

data.title: No flexibility at bar w/beer size
data.text: This is a very biased review based on 30 minutes of sitting at the bar. When I sat down I was surprised to see 3 sours listed on the board; very excited. Then the bartender proceeds to tell us that the sour I ordered was only available in 16 Oz. Are you kidding? Who serves a sour in 16 Oz and then proceeds to tell you that an 8 Oz is available at the same price. Needless to say that was ridiculous. Perhaps this place should take a lesson from Ballast Point where you can order 4, 8 or 16 Oz.

data.title: Really great Fish & Chips!
data.text: Great service, great different food, very tasty and not too much.  Many beers to choose from and good too!  Will go back again!

data.title: Fun drinks and good food
data.text: This is a very popular place. If you go on the weekend expect a wait. We just went on Monday and got right in. I have to go every once in a while just to solve my craving for the poutine - French fries with short rib meat and cheese. Gourmet burger selection. Excellent fish and chips. Lots of fun drinks on the menu. I recommend the Capone Cocktail. This is one of the places that the locals like, partly because they have some outside seating. Good service too. Nice place.

data.title: Nice looking restaurant with good food
data.text: We ate here for lunch on Memorial Day. The service was good and the food was very tasty. We especially liked the fried brussels sprouts. My wife had a mojito which she enjoyed as well.

data.title: Nice place to eat!
data.text: Our service was impeccable and the food enjoyable. The chicken pesto sandwich on ciabatta was bomb. The ranch salad dressing was bland though - disappointing because it was homemade and I had high hopes! The sea bass was outstanding, the oysters fresh and tasty and the BBQ burger was nicely done with a giant onion ring. It was a hot day and it was cooler inside but still warm. All in all, a good place to eat on a cute little street in Redlands!

data.title: Great atmosphere, drinks and food
data.text: Great cocktail menu. The poutine was beyond amazing. That dish alone assures we will be coming back!

data.title: Great Burger and Bar
data.text: Great downtown bar and burger joint.  Loved the Brussel Sprout appetizer and the Rise and Shine (i think that is it) Burger.  Great bar and drink selection and quick efficient and happy servers.  Highly recommend.

data.title: Great food and Huge Liquor assortment
data.text: Everything on their menu seems to be excellent. The portions are a little small and decorative, but they make up for it in quality. The portobella fries are so addictive! The New York steak was so incredibly tender and the burgers are absolutely delicious. The assortment of whiskeys and other spirits is huge! They are from all over the country, as well as the world. The place is always busy, and a little noisy, which is kind of a drawback, but also a testament to how good everything really is. You can't get a bad meal here!

data.title: Great burger and beer for lunch
data.text: During my short stay in Redlands I was able to grab lunch at the State. The place has a nice atmosphere, really good service, and the food was excellent. I look forward to visiting again soon!

data.title: An amazing gem of a place in Redlands
data.text: After having a dismal experience at the nearby British pub, we were looking for a place to cleanse or palette and save the night and lo and behold, The State saved the night. This is an amazing restaurant and bar with the friendliest serving staff in the Inland Empire. The ambience is amazing and the food is excellent! I highly recommend the portobello mushrooms fried in truffle oil; seriously an orgasmic experience. And the craft beers weren't that bad either. If you're looking for a fun and warm environment with amazing food and friendly people, this is the place to go. I'm definitely coming back!

data.title: Good food! Great service!
data.text:
I planned a scavenger hunt through downtown Redlands a couple of months ago. The staff and guests at this restaurant were amazing at supporting our birthday antics. I vowed then that I would be back to try their food.

Well last night was the night and I was beyond surprised at how much I enjoyed it. The staff was fantastic and our waitress even made suggestions based on some of our specifications. We ended up ordering everything she suggested and she was dead on. We shared the poutin fries...so so good! The truffle burger...equally delicious and lastly the Brussels sprouts. These were some of the best I have ever had.

Thank you state for doing food right and for adding to the experience by having good laid back attitudes :o)

data.title: Fun place
data.text: As a local, I have certain places I frequent more often than others. The State is a busy, trendy bar first and foremost, which also serves food. So, if you're up for a hustling and bustling type of atmosphere, this is a good place to go. The service can be kinda slow but I've had good luck with the food. The fish and chips and the BBQ burger are good and the butterscotch dessert was fantastic.

data.title: The bourbon
data.text: Being a huge bourbon fan I was very impressed with their overall selection and with a side of poutine I was set for the night, and will be going back
